ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Marlyse Duguid
Marlyse Duguid
Marlyse Duguid
Marlyse Duguid
marlyse duguid

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This was a very interesting course. The course was well coordinated and taught by the two Professors. We had a lot of useful, healthy and thought-provoking discussions about invasive species. The field trips were superb.

3. Was frustrating when we were asked to bring papers to class for discussion and then time wasn't allotted to discuss them.4. Readings were well chosen and informative.6. Would have like to have a bit more time for unstructured discussion, especially at the end of the semester as it would have allowed us to better synthesize what we learned and how our opinions of invasives changed over the course of the class.7a. Ann and Mary complimented each other well, although Mary was missed during the last month when she had many competing obligations.7b. Marlyse was well prepared, contributed significantly (especially with some worthwhile supplemental reading), and was always engaged. One of the better TAs I've had at FES.9c. Field trip to Mystic was FANTASTIC!
The small class size. This encouraged all the students to actually do the reading and take part in class discussions.
Small size of the class and the discussion-presentation approach of learning. Students had several opportunities to present case studies.

The relevance of the topic to the research I wish to pursue.Its small size, amount of discussion, and engagement of all students.As much as it was difficult to present on our paper topics so many times, it was great to hear our peer's presentations which were, for the most part, very well done.Examining and debunking some of the oft cited invasive species 'facts'.
The instructor-lead discussions, which happened often.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Towards the end of the course it was difficult to tell what the objective of each class was. Given the busy schedules of Ann and Mary, there seemed to be a lack of communication as to who was responsible for delivering the content of each class.
Would be helpful to be evaluated beyond the presentations and paper.Having some sort of end of semester wrap up class that allows for better closure.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Ann, Mary and Marlyse are always available and willing to provide assistance.
Didn't request any additionalhelp.
Marlyse was wonderful - responsive and helpful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Since I will be conducting independent research about invasive plants this summer, this class was critical to my research preparation and I was very thankful that it was scheduled to occur this semester.In a broader sense I think that this topic, in conjunction with climate change and carbon emissions, is one of the hot topics in forestry and environmental studies today so having a class dedicated to it at FES is excellent.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Because invasive species management is a growing concern in the field of land management and I thought the course might familiarize me with the topics surrounding the issue.
See answer to question 15.Also looked forward to the opportunity to get to know Mary Tyrrell.
I had always had slight involvement with invasive species but decided to supplement my knowledge with a broader spectrum of knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: For the most part.
Yes
Yes, it did. The peer interaction it afforded exceeded expectations.
yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes

I was hoping to make up my mind whether striving to eradicate invasive species once established is a lost cause or a worthwhile endeavor and admittedly I didn't come out of the class with my mind made on that topic, but I think that's okay. The class demonstrated what a nuanced and complex issue invasvies are, and it clarified for me that there isn't a straightforward opinion to necessarily adopt.
Absolutely

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Go for it! It's a great course

Carefully select your topic for the presentations and paper, as you will spend a lot of time working on it. In selecting your topic think not only about what interests you, but also what will be appealing to the class because they will be hearing about your topic many times over the course of the semester.Come prepared to discuss. This was the first class at FES where I was able to ask almost any question I wanted and was able to talk concerns out. Use the discussion based atmosphere to its utmost.Attend all of the field trips--they're worthwhile and often don't require a full day.
